alert.note: Alert for Putnam (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 3:56PM CDT until July 20 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following county, Putnam. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 PM CDT, The threat for Flash Flooding has ended, but some areas are still experiencing high water including Poplar Grove Rd in the Cookeville area as reported by Putnam County Emergency Management. Any remaining high water is expected to slowly subside this afternoon. - This includes the following areas and streams... Algood, Cookeville, Falling Water River including areas near Cookeville, and Blackburn Fork including Double Springs and Cummins Falls State Park. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cookeville, Algood, Monterey and Baxter. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
